front.title: Adding an Uncacheable Directory Attribute to NFSv4.2

abstract.t: The Network File System version 4.2 (NFSv4.2) allows a client to cache both metadata for file and directory objects. While caching directory entries (dirents) can improve performance, it can also prevent the server from enforcing access control on individual dirents. This document introduces a new uncacheable directory attribute for NFSv4.2. Dirents marked as uncacheable MUST NOT be stored in client-side caches. This ensures data consistency and integrity by requiring clients to always retrieve the most recent data directly from the server. This document extends NFSv4.2 (see RFC7862).
